thread.section_title: News Article Archive from M03 22, 2018 - Wsj.com
thread.title: Parkland Activists Inspire Newtown Teens to Join Gun-Control Movement

author: Joseph De Avila
title: Parkland Activists Inspire Newtown Teens to Join Gun-Control Movement
text:
It took the Parkland shooting for Newtown students to get jolted into action.
The students from Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Fla., where a gunman shot and killed 17 people in February, have inspired young people across the U.S. with their social-media-savvy activism. Their work has particularly resonated in Newtown, Conn., a community overshadowed by a similar tragedy.
... RELATED VIDEO How Student Survivors Are Fueling a Gun-Control Movement In the wake of the school shooting in Parkland, Fla., that left 17 people dead, student survivors have started a movement for greater gun control. Two students from Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School explain how social media, crowdfunding and political activism have helped spread their message. Photo: Getty Images
